conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The v-t graph shows Car A with a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 s to t = 30 s, and Car B accelerating uniformly from t = 0 s to t = 30 s.
Car A travels at a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 s to t = 30 s.
Car B accelerates uniformly from t = 0 s to t = 30 s.
The distance traveled by Car A from t = 10 s to t = 30 s is 800 m.
The distance traveled by Car B from t = 0 s to t = 30 s is 600 m.
At t = 30 s, both cars are side by side.
We need to find another instance when the cars are side by side.
At t = 20 s, Car A has traveled 400 m.
At t = 20 s, Car B's distance is approximately 266.67 m.
The distance between Car A and Car B at t = 20 s is 133.33 m.
The maximum distance between Car A and Car B between the two instances when they are side by side is 133.33 meters.
